t: Luke 14
Jesus Heals on the Sabbath
It*p happened that when He went into the house of one of the leaders of the Pharisees on the*i Sabbath to eat bread, they were watching Him closely.
And there in front of Him was a man suffering from dropsy.
And Jesus answered and spoke to the lawyers and Pharisees, saying, “Is*r it*r lawful*r to*r heal*r on*r the*r Sabbath,*r or*r not?”*r
But they kept silent. And He took hold of him and healed him, and sent him away.
And He said to them, “Which*r one*r of*r you*r will*r have*r a*r son*r or*r an*r ox*r fall*r into*r a*r well,*r and*r will*r not*r immediately*r pull*r him*r out*r on*r a*r Sabbath*r day?”*r
And they could make no reply to this.
Parable of the Guests
And*p He began*i speaking a parable to the invited guests when He noticed how they had been picking out the places of honor at*i the*i table,*i saying to them,

“When*r you*r are*r invited*r by*r someone*r to*r a*r wedding*r feast,*r do*r not*r take*r the*r place*r of*r honor,*r for*r someone*r more*r distinguished*r than*r you*r may*r have*r been*r invited*r by*r him,*r

and*r he*r who*r invited*r you*r both*r will*r come*r and*r say*r to*r you,*r ‘Give*r your*ir place*r to*r this*r man,’*r and*r then*r in*r disgrace*r you*r proceed*r to*r occupy*r the*r last*r place.*r

But*r when*r you*r are*r invited,*r go*r and*r recline*r at*r the*r last*r place,*r so*r that*r when*r the*r one*r who*r has*r invited*r you*r comes,*r he*r may*r say*r to*r you,*r ‘Friend,*r move*r up*r higher’;*r then*r you*r will*r have*r honor*r in*r the*r sight*r of*r all*r who*r are*r at*r the*r table*r with*r you.*r
For*r everyone*r who*r exalts*r himself*r will*r be*r humbled,*r and*r he*r who*r humbles*r himself*r will*r be*r exalted.”*r

And*p He also went on to say to the one who had invited Him, “When*r you*r give*r a*r luncheon*r or*r a*r dinner,*r do*r not*r invite*r your*r friends*r or*r your*r brothers*r or*r your*r relatives*r or*r rich*r neighbors,*r otherwise*r they*r may*r also*r invite*r you*r in*r return*r and*r that*ir will*r be*r your*r repayment.*r
But*r when*r you*r give*r a*r reception,*r invite*r the*ir poor,*r the*ir crippled,*r the*ir lame,*r the*ir blind,*r
and*r you*r will*r be*r blessed,*r since*r they*r do*r not*r have*r the*ir means*ir to*r repay*r you;*r for*r you*r will*r be*r repaid*r at*r the*r resurrection*r of*r the*r righteous.”*r
When*p one of those who were reclining at*i the*i table*i with Him heard this, he said to Him, “Blessed is everyone who will eat bread in the kingdom of God!”
Parable of the Dinner
But*p He said to him, “A*r man*r was*r giving*r a*r big*r dinner,*r and*r he*r invited*r many;*r
and*r at*r the*r dinner*r hour*r he*r sent*r his*r slave*r to*r say*r to*r those*r who*r had*r been*r invited,*r ‘Come;*r for*r everything*r is*r ready*r now.’*r

But*r they*r all*r alike*r began*r to*r make*r excuses.*r The*r first*r one*r said*r to*r him,*r ‘I*r have*r bought*r a*r piece*r of*r land*r and*r I*r need*r to*r go*r out*r and*r look*r at*r it;*r please*r consider*r me*r excused.’*r
Another*r one*r said,*r ‘I*r have*r bought*r five*r yoke*r of*r oxen,*r and*r I*r am*r going*r to*r try*r them*r out;*r please*r consider*r me*r excused.’*r
Another*r one*r said,*r ‘I*r have*r married*r a*r wife,*r and*r for*r that*r reason*r I*r cannot*r come.’*r

And*r the*r slave*r came*r back*ir and*r reported*r this*r to*r his*r master.*r Then*r the*r head*r of*r the*r household*r became*r angry*r and*r said*r to*r his*r slave,*r ‘Go*r out*r at*r once*r into*r the*r streets*r and*r lanes*r of*r the*r city*r and*r bring*r in*r here*r the*r poor*r and*r crippled*r and*r blind*r and*r lame.’*r
And*r the*r slave*r said,*r ‘Master,*r what*r you*r commanded*r has*r been*r done,*r and*r still*r there*r is*r room.’*r

And*r the*r master*r said*r to*r the*r slave,*r ‘Go*r out*r into*r the*r highways*r and*r along*r the*r hedges,*r and*r compel*r them*ir to*r come*r in,*r so*r that*r my*r house*r may*r be*r filled.*r
For*r I*r tell*r you,*r none*r of*r those*r men*r who*r were*r invited*r shall*r taste*r of*r my*r dinner.’ ”*r
Discipleship Tested
Now*p large crowds were going along with Him; and He turned and said to them,

“If*r anyone*r comes*r to*r Me,*r and*r does*r not*r hate*r his*r own*r father*r and*r mother*r and*r wife*r and*r children*r and*r brothers*r and*r sisters,*r yes,*r and*r even*r his*r own*r life,*r he*r cannot*r be*r My*r disciple.*r
Whoever*r does*r not*r carry*r his*r own*r cross*r and*r come*r after*r Me*r cannot*r be*r My*r disciple.*r

For*r which*r one*r of*r you,*r when*r he*r wants*r to*r build*r a*r tower,*r does*r not*r first*r sit*r down*r and*r calculate*r the*r cost*r to*r see*r if*r he*r has*r enough*r to*r complete*r it?*r
Otherwise,*r when*r he*r has*r laid*r a*r foundation*r and*r is*r not*r able*r to*r finish,*r all*r who*r observe*r it*r begin*r to*r ridicule*r him,*r
saying,*r ‘This*r man*r began*r to*r build*r and*r was*r not*r able*r to*r finish.’*r

Or*r what*r king,*r when*r he*r sets*r out*r to*r meet*r another*r king*r in*r battle,*r will*r not*r first*r sit*r down*r and*r consider*r whether*r he*r is*r strong*r enough*r with*r ten*r thousand*r men*ir to*r encounter*r the*r one*r coming*r against*r him*r with*r twenty*r thousand?*r
Or*r else,*r while*r the*r other*r is*r still*r far*r away,*r he*r sends*r a*r delegation*r and*r asks*r for*r terms*r of*r peace.*r
So*r then,*r none*r of*r you*r can*r be*r My*r disciple*r who*r does*r not*r give*r up*r all*r his*r own*r possessions.*r
“Therefore,*rp salt*r is*r good;*r but*r if*r even*r salt*r has*r become*r tasteless,*r with*r what*r will*r it*r be*r seasoned?*r
It*r is*r useless*r either*r for*r the*r soil*r or*r for*r the*r manure*r pile;*r it*r is*r thrown*r out.*r He*r who*r has*r ears*r to*r hear,*r let*r him*r hear.”*r
